title: Global Economic Powerhouses
description: The USA, China, and India control over 60% of the world's economy. With GDPs exceeding $26T, $17T, and $3T respectively, these nations shape global trade, tech, and military dominance. Discover how their growth and spending rival each other in this 50-second breakdown!

segments.text: Do you know the USA, China, and India control over 60% of the world's economy? Their combined GDP surpasses the rest of the planet combined.
The USA has a GDP of $26 trillion, the largest economy ever recorded. It also spends $800 billion annually on military power.
China's GDP is $17.7 trillion, making it the second-largest economy. Its Belt and Road Initiative connects over 140 countries with infrastructure projects.
India's GDP is $3.1 trillion, growing at 7% year over year. With 1.4 billion people, it's becoming a tech and manufacturing powerhouse.
The USA leads in military spending, China dominates global trade, and India's youth population fuels its economic rise. Who will shape the future?
What happens when these giants clash over resources, tech, and influence? The next decade could rewrite the world order.
Do you know the USA, China, and India control over 60% of the world's economy? Their combined GDP surpasses the rest of the planet combined.
